intro: Agrostis abakanensis, commonly known as the Abakan grass, is a species of grass native to Central Asia and parts of Russia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and rocky soils. The plant has slender,丛生的 stems and small, narrow leaves that are usually covered with fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is often loosely arranged. Agrostis abakanensis is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native range.
